info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 1:26PM MDT until July 30 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico, including the following county, Otero and western Texas, including the following county, Hudspeth.
* WHEN...Until 430 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall of up to 0.5 to 1 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cornudas Mountains. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
